messages.subject: in defense of Flylady OT
messages.msgSnippet: Hey!  Don t badmouth Flylady! Go to her homepage, click on Flying Lessons, and read about shining your sink.  Sure, she mentions filling it with water, adding
messages.messageBody:
Hey! Don't badmouth Flylady!
Go to her homepage, click on Flying Lessons, and read about shining your
sink. Sure, she mentions filling it with water, adding bleach, using a
toothbrush and dental floss if necessary. But she's talking about how to
clean even the oldest sinks. And at the end of the paragraph she says
>
> You have already done the hard part. You will never have to go through this
> process again. Daily maintenance will keep it looking this way all the time

She says she just rubs it down with a dry rag at night.
Flylady was the kick in the pants I needed to start getting my home under
control. I don't follow her "religiously", but I get lots of good ideas
there. There are LOADS of people on this list, and for those who haven't
heard of her, I didn't want anyone left with the impression that her advice
was irresponsible.

Please read this letter in the lighthearted way it was intended. I'm not
scolding you. Sometimes it is SO HARD to get a message across "the right
way" in e-mail.
Mary J


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
